name: Peach Sangria
description: This recipe came to The Times from David Mas Masumoto, who is an organic-peach-and-grape farmer and author. The drink is bright and fizzy and full of delicious summer. It’s a great accompaniment to brunch, or just an excellent way to end a hot day.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and pit 5 of the peaches and cut them into chunks. Place in a food processor and blend until smooth. Add the sugar and blend until combined. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve. In a 3 1/2 -quart container, combine the peach purée, wine and lemon. Cover and refrigerate overnight. An hour before serving, thinly slice the remaining peaches and add them to the sangria along with the blueberries. Serve over ice.
